mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian hollow ceramic bust of a woman with minimal facial features. The figure depicts breasts and long hair as well as three appliqu√© ear spools in each ear. The figure has a necklace as well. This figure is strange as it looks to be made completely different than others said to be from this area especially if it is Tolitan. The features are far more simple than others and the walls of this hollow figurine are much thicker than usual. The paste is also a completely different color than others from Esmereldas, Ecuador. The figure also sits on a simple wooden stand.
Some breakage at the arms the left being glued back on. Some chipping in other places and regular wear.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
